Interrupt - ARM NVIC support functions
mcu » apollo330P

Purpose: This module provides helper functions for supporting interrupts and NVIC (Nested Vectored Interrupt Controller) operations on Apollo5 devices. It supports interrupt enable/disable, master interrupt control, and interrupt state management for system interrupt handling and control.

Key Features

  1. Master Interrupt Control: Global interrupt enable/disable functionality.
  2. NVIC Support: ARM NVIC interrupt controller support.
  3. Interrupt State: Interrupt state management and control.
  4. Compiler Support: Multi-compiler support for interrupt operations.
  5. Priority Management: Interrupt priority handling and control.

Functionality

  • Enable and disable master interrupts globally
  • Control interrupt state and priority
  • Support NVIC interrupt operations
  • Handle interrupt enable/disable operations
  • Provide compiler-specific interrupt implementations

Usage

  1. Enable master interrupts using am_hal_interrupt_master_enable()
  2. Disable master interrupts using am_hal_interrupt_master_disable()
  3. Set interrupt state as needed
  4. Handle interrupt operations and state management
  5. Control interrupt priorities and NVIC operations

Configuration

  • Master Interrupt: Configure global interrupt enable/disable
  • NVIC Settings: Set up NVIC interrupt controller parameters
  • Priority Levels: Configure interrupt priority levels
  • Compiler: Set up compiler-specific interrupt implementations
